title: Idea to Combat Leavers...
body:
Hi guys and girls,

In a nutshell Ranked Lockouts for any sort of AFK, DC etc.
I imagine the following three cases;

1. DC < 5 min no punishment. 
2. If someone has DCed for a short amount of time and reconnects to the game, they have a 24 hour Ranked Queue lock out.
3. If someone DC's/AFKs and does not come back, they have a week lockout from Ranked Queue. 

____

In respect to good players,
- If you DC for more than 5 min I think it's fair to say you are adversely effecting a game. 24 hours to norms to sort stuff out I believe is fair
- What if it's on Rito's end/bug splat etc? Once again, if you are having these issue which are lasting more than 5 min regardless if it's your fault, you should stick to norms till you know its ironed out.
- If you have to leave for an emergency; it happens, and if it something that rarely happens then you should be be able to accept the one-off one week penalty. 

___

Love to hear your feedback,
Skyprus

replies.body:
>    DC < 5 min no punishment.
    If someone has DCed for a short amount of time and reconnects to the game, they have a 24 hour Ranked Queue lock out.
    If someone DC's/AFKs and does not come back, they have a week lockout from Ranked Queue.

1st is fine, as that is how it's stands, 2nd seems fair enough, but that 3rd one is kinda bullshit, a week for dcing and not being able to reconnect (remember we have times where Rito's end has firewall errors and such that make getting back in hard)

Unless Rito makes a way of being able to revert these bans if they actually aren't deserved (IE it's one of the times that Loss prevented should have been on but wasn't) then it's a bit harsh.

This being said, i can understand it, i just think 1 week is a bit harsh for someone who might only play ranked games.

Yer I can see that.
Does three days seem fairer to you?

My suggestion would be that chronic leaver status can give a week off ranked, and that the day restriction is probably as far as you should go otherwise.

A week ban from ranked for something you can't stop that probably won't happen for the whole week your ranked banned?

I like the idea that the bans get progressively longer.
So perhaps everyone starts off with a one days ban.
And as long as you don't regular receive this it will remain there.
Increased bans within a short period result in the bans getting longer.

Pretty much, if your banned 3-4 days a week, likelihood is that a week ban is required (and says to the person fix this).

Like i have leaves (i think i have one ranked leave and that was due to a family issue) but they aren't chronic by any means, and in general i try to avoid it wherever possible.

> - If you DC for more than 5 min I think it's fair to say you are adversely effecting a game. 24 hours to norms to sort stuff out I believe is fair
> - What if it's on Rito's end/bug splat etc? Once again, if you are having these issue which are lasting more than 5 min regardless if it's your fault, you should stick to norms till you know its ironed out.

In no way are both this alternatives fair. Some peoples internet may crash/bug out for more than a period of 30 minutes or so, people may have a power outage in their house/street that causes them to unintentionally leave a game. To be punished by not having access to ranked queses for over 24 hours for one game that you had no control over leaving isn't fair whatsoever, these are outrageous punishments for such a little crime. Their punishment for afking is fair enough already, afk a game or two and you have a lower priority in ranked que which goes up the more you afk in a game which eventually leads to a ban and that's not even including the banning from the leaver buster/reports they'd receive from the other players in the game.

If you bug out rarely how is 24 hours harsh?
It's one day of norms.

If something big happens, like a power outage, you most likely lost a game for you team whether intentional or not. 
Maybe 3 days, rather than a week. 
But either way, how is this small lock out, which you should rarely get unfair. 

If you are having crashes or power outages in a certain a period of time, you should return to normals anyway till you know the issue is sorted. 
This is just enforcing that idea.

the punishment for AFK is such a joke that you are lucky to get a game in bronze/silver where no one does. If your internet is unreliable enough that it can crash for half an hour you shouldnt be ranking anyway. If there is power outages you shouldnt be ranking anyway, and if its an accident that caused you a power outage you are going to have problems for around 24 hours anyway so not being able to ranked wouldnt affect anyone.

I suggested in another post 

I think AFK should wear 1/2 of your LP lost, e.g. 5 people in the team 1 DC then if the LP lost is 20lp each then all the non afk will only lose 10 lp and the AFK should lose 20 + 10 + 10 +10 +10 =60LP now watch how the AFK rate will improve when every time they AFK will cost them at least like 50 LP

The reason why LP reduction schemes don't work is due to smurfs/duo exploits.
To clarify anyone can duo with someone on their real account, if losing, the smurf can leave and get their partner less LP lost, and not care about the tank to the smurf. 

I once shared you view, and after having this pointed out have tried to come up with a new non-exploitable scheme. 
Which will punish regular leavers heavily and hopefully good players not too much.
Yeah that's why i said half of the LP not all of it

Even if it wasn't exploited, I feel like this idea while providing no compensation, should help to minimize the problem. 
And you know what they say, prevention is better than a cure.

well it help the players that get AFKed on with some kind of compensation "half the LP"

and when AFKers get a 50LP lost, i am sure they will think twice next time before doing it and if they do it offend they will get time Bans as well
If your on a smurf, 50 LP loss is nothing, whereas a week is a shit ton.

2.If someone has DCed for a short amount of time and reconnects to the game, they have a 24 hour Ranked Queue lock out.
^ this your internet might cut out for like 3 secs then come back why ban them?

Point 1 stated less than 5 minutes would receive punishment.
Point 3 stated if the did not come back it was week.
Hence it is implied that point 2 was for a duration longer than 5 minutes but required the player reconnect before the end of the game. 

You will not be banned if you are gone longer than 5 minutes, which I think is enough time to bug splat, reconnect etc.
